result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon S. Whitely was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Devon S. Whitely is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Devon S. Whitely was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct as a County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Disorderly Conduct as a County Ordinance
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on December 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.

1:11 PM Defendant Devon S. Whitely in court.  Attorney Scott Harold Southworth in court for Devon S. Whitely.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin. Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.  Not Guilty, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.  Schedule with Br. 2 JA in the next 2 weeks or will be put on trial calendar.  State requests set motion for bond modification for victim testimony.  Court will take motion up today.  Court denies motion at this time.
to Modify Bond

1:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund and Intern, Dan Moon, in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon S. Whitely in court.  Attorney Scott Harold Southworth in court for Devon S. Whitely.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.
Arraignment scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on August 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on June 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
DE may only have contact with the victim (J.T.M.) by electronic means.

11:04 AM  Defendant Devon S. Whitely in court.  Attorney Scott Harold Southworth in court for Devon S. Whitely.  Attorney Natalia J Gess in court for State of Wisconsin.  Victim (J.T.M.) also appears in person.  Court states case and appearances.  State is still objecting to modification of the bond.  Court has J.T.M. take the witness stand and asks her questions.  J.T.M. states she's currently residing in South Dakota so she drove 6 hours back for this hearing.  State questions J.T.M.  Atty Southworth asks questions of J.T.M.  Court asks more questions of J.T.M.  State continues to object to any modification of the no contact order.   Atty Southworth makes argument.  Court modifies the bond to:  DE may only have contact with the victim (J.T.M.) by electronic means.
Hearing on May 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on May 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Victim's Petition to Modify Bond
No contact with J.T.M. or her residence or her place of employment.  May return to any shared residence one time upon prior notice and with law enforcement to retrieve belongings if necessary.

Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Return date on June 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
No contact with J.T.M. or her residence or her place of employment.  May return to any shared residence one time upon prior notice and with law enforcement to retrieve belongings if necessary.

02:33 PM Defendant Devon S. Whitely in court with attorney Scott Harold Southworth.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $650 cash bond posted.  State takes no position as to cash vs. signature bond but asks for conditions.  Atty Southworth requests signature bond instead of the cash bond posted.  Court orders $650.00 signature bond.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with J.T.M. or her residence or her place of employment.  May return to any shared residence one time upon prior notice and with law enforcement to retrieve belongings if necessary.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.  Return date scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
